Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [looking pregnant] Hey Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Contractions are coming every ten minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, just remember to keep breathing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: My cervix is ripening.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, good.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [drawing two family trees on a whiteboard] Jan is about to have a baby with a sperm donor. And Michael is preparing for the birth of a watermelon with Dwight. Now, this baby will be related to Michael through [draws a question mark] delusion.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael! My water's breaking!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, OK! OK!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Aaaaaaaa! What do you do? What do you do?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I get a call from Jan and I meet her at the hospital.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Right. Highways or surface roads?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I take Quincy Ave to Gibson.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, Gibson is covered in potholes. Your car breaks down. Adapt!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I checked the route - there are no potholes. Come on, get in here and have the baby.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's about adapting to the circumstances.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [annoyed] Andy, would you like to have my baby?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes! Yeah. [squatting and pushing] Aaaaaaaa! Aaaaaaaa! Aaaaaaaa!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. OK, no. I'm crowning! I'm crowning! Aaaaaaaa! [runs into Michael's office]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, OK. [to Andy] Sorry. Sorry. Here we go. Here we go!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The pressure! The pressure!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do it! Do it! Scream! Scream it out, scream it out, scream it out.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Aaaaaaaa!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Aaaaaaaa!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Babies are one of my many areas of expertise. Growing up, I performed my own circumcision.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just keep pushing...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [lying on Michael's desk] Hold me!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm right here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Cradle my head!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm right here, I'm right here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm screaming, I'm screaming, I'm screaming! Aaaaaaaa!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [annoyed] All right. Dwight. Just push and breathe.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Numb me up. I want anesthesia!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shhh. No, you can't have it. It's too late.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No! I don't want natural!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. You have to just push it out!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Keep simulating.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Aaaaaaaa!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do you have the Sharpie?!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Keep simulating.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do you have the Sharpie?!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, I do!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK! When the baby emerges, mark it secretly in a kind of a mark that only you could recognize and no baby snatcher can ever copy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ready?!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Aaaaaaaa!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Aaaaaaaa! It's coming! Here we go! [drops the watermelon onto the floor] Oh! God! Wow! What was on that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Butter. Newborns are slippery.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nice touch. Good. Let's try that again.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [eating the watermelon] It is going to be the happiest day of my life. [Dwight gets dressed behind Michael and zips his fly]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello ladies, how's my shower going? Phyllis, did you get the live storks?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Damnit, Phyllis! I'm sorry. [more softly] Damnit, Phyllis. It was hard enough to convince Jan to come. So are we set for refreshments?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Per your instructions, we have the personalized M&Ms with the baby names. This is your boy bowl, with the name "Chevy." And this is the girl bowl, with M&Ms with the name "Astird."

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: That can't be right.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Michael wrote down "Astird."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She said it is the name of a Viking princess. So...

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Ass...turd.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know. I know. It is beautiful. No. Thank you. Is this it? I mean, is this... Two bowls of M&Ms and some balloons? You know what Phyllis, I think you need to step it up. I think you need to get the lead out. Because if I'm not mistaken, we gave you your wedding shower here. We all came into this room and gave you a golden shower. Well you know what, where's my golden shower, Phyllis?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It does not matter to me at all whether this baby is biologically mine. I am going to love it. It's like when the dog nurses the tiger cub. Have you seen that video? It is... it's so bizarre and unnatural, but... it, it happens.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hey, I'm collecting for the baby shower.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: But Phyllis, it's not his baby.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I know, Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Why do we have to pay money to get a gift for his ex-girlfriend's unborn sperm bank baby?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Look at it as if you're paying for the cake, not the baby. Sheet cake.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I do enjoy being the head of the Party Planning Committee. I'm no longer under Angela's heel, and her little grape head is under mine.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [banging on the glass] Hey, hey. What are you doing? Don't talk to them.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Make the party. Don't - make the party, please, Phyllis. [Phyllis starts inflating a balloon with a pump] Pump it!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [on phone] So you know Stacy, right?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right, the one from England.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: There's no one from England, Jim. Katie studied in Ireland - this is Stacy, the one who does the Murakami-style collages.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh. Right, that style.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So, Stacy and Eric get to Bogre's DeTech half an hour early so they don't have to sit on the slab.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Anyway, Bogre's TA Sarah Kaya comes in.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait, who's Sarah Kayacombsen?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, Sarah Kaya comes in. Don't interrupt, I have like thirty seconds to finish this and get to DigiPres.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So Sarah Kaya says to Eric, "No way. You can't reserve seats." And Stacy gets all up in her face and Sarah Kaya picks up Stacy's new PM pad and throws it at the light box.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [clearly just humoring her] No... way!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ha ha. That's hilarious?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, it's horrible! Jim, she might get arrested.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Who, Stacy?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, Stacy is a boy. Ugh. Frustrating. Why can't you just be in art class with me?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, wait, I gotta go, class starting. [hangs up]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, I'll ta...I'll talk to you later. [hangs up] That was a good story.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Who's Sarah Kayacombsen?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yo. I got the Nard-puppy for ya. What's going on here?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's a baby game where you guess whose picture is whose.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Awww. Check it out - who would have thought that this little baby would be marrying that little baby?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: That's Phyllis.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well -

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yeah, it is. So I hope you two are very happy together. Pervert.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Why would that make me a pervert, I -

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Well, it does. That's me.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That's not you.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes it is.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That's mean, come on, that's - [Angela storms out]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ahoy, matey.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Ahoy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ahoy. So, how you doin'?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, listen. Jan Levinson is coming in today, and she is in the terminal stages of her pregnancy - the child of which I have a vested interest. It's all kind of weird. Anyway, she is incredibly... fat and enormous right now - extremely unattractive. And you are, on the other hand, one of the more attractive people in the office. So, while she's here I am going to be acting kind of cold to you. And I am doing this to pay respect to her bloated feelings. And I'm treating Ryan the same way.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Of course. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I do not like pregnant women in my workspace. They're always complaining. I have varicose veins, too. I have swollen ankles, I'm constantly hungry - do you think my nipples don't get sore too? Do you think I don't need to know the fastest way to the hospital?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Jan enters the office, pushing a stroller] Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Hi, Jim!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What do we have here?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: This is my baby.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh no... [Michael enters and notices Jan's baby]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jan had the baby and Michael wasn't there to mark it. So the baby could be anybody's. Except Michael's.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So this is Astird.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Astrid.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, OK. Why didn't you call me?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well, um, you know, labor just kind of started very suddenly and-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I could have helped.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: And the birth instructor thought it wasn't a good idea for you to be there, so...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, man. Him? That guy? He had no sense of humor and I proved him wrong in so many ways.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: OK, you don't have any idea what I've been through, so, let's...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I don't!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, I thought today at the baby shower would be a good time for the two of you to meet.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Can I hold her?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Yes, yes you can. You know, I think, just leave her in the car seat. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [cradling the car seat awkwardly] All right, OK.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I love babies. I think they are beautiful in all sorts of different ways. I try to pick up and hold a baby every day, if possible, because it nourishes me. It feeds my soul. Babies are drawn to me, and I think it's because they see me as one of them. But cooler, and with my life put together a little bit. If a baby were president, there would be no taxes, there would be no war. There would be no government, and things could get terrible. It actually, probably - it would be a better screenplay idea than a serious suggestion.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [carrying the car seat] Ladies and gentlemen, it is my privilege and honor to present for the first time in her life and in the office:

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ready to play some games? Let's do it!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Michael, the baby's already been born.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, duh.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: So we had games planned but the baby ruins all of them.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, the baby doesn't ruin anything, Kevin, OK? The baby multiplies the fun. Let's just do what you were going to do.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: OK... Who wants to guess when the baby will be born?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, how about some presents? I want to see some presents. [holding a memo pad] I got this so I can write down for thank-you notes.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Thank you. That's very sweet of you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whatta we got?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Um, we all chipped in and got you this stroller.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She already has a stroller.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: And this is way worse than the stroller she came with.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: She's got an Orbit; that's a twelve hundred dollar stroller.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Huh. Twelve hundred dollars for a stroller? Phhhbt.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, what else?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Twelve hundred dollars is what I spent on my whole bomb shelter. For that kind of money, this stroller should be indestructible. [straps the watermelon into the stroller on the elevator]

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [singing "Son of a Preacher Man" to Astrid] Being good isn't always easy / No matter how hard I try / When he started sweet-talking to me / He'd come and tell me everything is all right / He'd kiss and tell me everything is all right / Can I get away again tonight / The only one...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey you!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on phone] Hey! You busy?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Not even. I'm doing laundry for the first time in like a month.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, OK, so you gotta hear this. So, Jan's shower is going on right now, and she's singing "Son of a Preacher Man" and everyone's just staring at her.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I can't hear anything, there's like, there's like machines going-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The song is about losing your virginity next to a church, and guess what - she's been singing for the last twenty minutes!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I can't hear anything!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh. OK, well you know what, I um, just call me later.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm not frustrated. Even if I were in Scranton, Jim and I would have days like this. We're just... a little out of sync. You know, that's all. Oh, great. I washed my lipstick.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [now belting out the lyrics, even though Astrid is asleep] How well I remember / The look that was in his eyes / Stealing kisses from me on the sly / Taking time to make time / Telling me that he's all mine / Learning from each other's knowing / Looking to see how much we've grown / And the only one...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [heaving the stroller into a tire yard] Don't hit the fence. Oh no, my child!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [throwing the stroller against a high chain link fence] Don't get stuck on the barbed wire!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [tossing the stroller off a tall heap of tires] Playtime is over!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So Jan, tell my intended about the miracle of childbirth.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well, actually, I, uh, I had a tub birth. And it was really, really quite amazing.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You gave birth in a tub?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Yeah, it's a really nice transition from womb to world, you know, kind of like a big womb.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Um, so you're in the tub with everything?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, the afterbirth floats, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Must be like the tide at Omaha Beach.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh no, it's actually really hygienic, Creed.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Ugh.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I'm done.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Me too.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: And after the birth you get out and deliver the afterbirth. [everyone starts leaving]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey! Hey, no no no no no no no no. No. No. This is the birth story. It was beautiful. It was beautiful. This is a once-in-a-lifetime experience. And I should have been there. I should have been there to witness this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I could have helped.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You're sad about this. I know that, and I wish that I... but... would it help if you held Astrid for just a, a little bit?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [smiling] Uh, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: All right. Um, I'm just going to lie down for a couple of minutes. I'm exhausted, so um. Remind me to talk to you about Astrid's 529. Wake me in twenty.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [voiceover] I usually love babies, but when I held Astrid I just felt... shortchanged.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Phyllis? Could you take-.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey guys.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What's up, Mike?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, I need some advice from one baby daddy to another.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You a baby daddy?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I a baby daddy. Um, when you first became a baby daddy, did you have an immediate connection with that baby? Like, the first time that you held it, did you find that with your baby baby?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hell yeah. You know why? Because that was my baby.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I just saw this baby daddy-

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You should stop calling yourself "baby daddy."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why, Darryl, because I'm quote white quote unquote?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Because you're not a daddy, and it's not your baby.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well-

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You feel connected to his baby over there?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's- that's different.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You feel connected to this? [hold up his back brace]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's not a baby.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You want to hold me, to see how you feel?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sighs] Could I?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [wakes up on the reception couch] Oh. I was just catching up on my sleep.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: I can imagine.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Where's Astrid?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, I think she's on a sales call.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: On a what?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Waaa! More paper! Waaa! [she cracks herself up but Jan is unimpressed] No, she's just on a coffee break.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [sarcastically] That's funny.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: She's with Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [with Astrid covered in and surrounded by vegetables on a lunch table] That's good. Now, I need you to - I need it to look up here. Get the baby to look up here, ready?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: OK. Yeah. Look at my finger. Look. Looook!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Now. Come on, up here!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Look up here!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Your hand's in it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What? Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yeah, that's a good one.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What are you doing? What's going on? Excuse me.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We're taking a picture.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [picking up Astrid] There you are.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: She's nature's bounty.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You don't flash around a newborn baby. Don't you know that?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael, I need your help.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sees Holly behind Jan] I was just going to... I was going to talk to Holly, about her hygiene. She smells like old tomatoes and dirt.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Uh... come on.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I like to call this... the bumper test. [drags the stroller behind his car and runs into it several times]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sure you can't stay a little longer?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh, no, Michael, you know what? I really have to go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right. All right, everybody, we're leaving. Jan and Astrid are leaving.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You know what, where is the stroller that I came in with?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh. I took the liberty of putting it in your trunk.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Ah. Thanks, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: OK. You know what? There is, uh, there is one more thing that you can do for me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Don't date Holly.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wha - that's, I hate her. Wha - God! Why would you even ask me to - I, I mean, not that it matters, 'cause I don't, but wha - OK, all right, fine.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Thanks for the baby shower. It was great. And I'll see you... soon.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: You still gonna be mean to me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [just hugs her, and she hugs him back and smiles] You wanna go out?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I didn't feel much when I held Astrid, but I got a good feeling from Holly.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on voicemail] Hey, it's Jim. Leave a message.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [on voicemail, because she's calling Jim at the same time] Hi, this is Pam. Leave a message.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [walking to his car] Hey, it's me. It is 5:03.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I figured I'd catch you walking to your car, but...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You must be out or something.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'll leave a message.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is it me, or are we just a little off today?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I guess this is just one of those days. It'll get better.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hope you didn't have any major laundry issues.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I finished my laundry. Got all my socks. Nothing like that time that crazy guy pushed you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Remember that time that I helped you do your laundry and that crazy guy came in and started yelling at you?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And then, remember, we went shopping the next day to buy me a washer and dryer?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yet here you are, back in a Laundromat. Now, I'm just trying to help you, Beesly. Be safe.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You're probably upset that I'm even at a Laundromat right now. But, don't worry, I'm being safe. And I'm headed home. I'm... headed to my dorm. Not home.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wish you were home. Uh, anyway...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Anyway, um... I miss you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I miss you.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: All right, how about we play the game where we guess how big the mother's belly is?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh! OK!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: How many squares of toilet paper go around the waist?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Does that mean there's no toilet paper in the bathroom?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Kevin, relax.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: OK, you know what, I don't think I need to do this one, because I only gained twelve pounds and I'm just going to get rid of all of that, so...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Seventeen. I say seventeen squares.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: OK, give me the roll. I'll do it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do the boobs!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Yeah, we're not doing my boobs, Michael. OK, seven, someone give me the prize. [to Astrid] Oh, it's OK...

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Did she really just have a baby? She's so beautiful.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh yeah. Wait 'til you get to know her better though.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey! HR lady, stop whispering in the corner please. Very rude. You're ruining the party.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: I'm starting to get a feeling for what life was like around here for Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [on the phone] It was terrible.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I prefer being stuck in a Costa Rican hospital.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Not really.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hey Jan, you went to a sperm bank?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Uh, yes, I did.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I donated sperm.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Maybe I'm the father.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well, this is a highly exclusive establishment.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Next to the IHOP?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well, I paid for an ideal specimen.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Are you saying Kevin is not an ideal specimen?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: This is a wonderful shower, everyone. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [to camera] I might have done it with Jan!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: It's not Kevin's child. Can't possibly be. I mean, I don't know what I would do. Sue... icide?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [Jan nurses Astrid with her top down, office workers try to work] Okay, 'Stridly, you want to try the other side? Okay, here we go. That's good. Oh, good job.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Jan? What's new?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You know what, Kevin? Why don't you just go ahead and stare? Because, you know, it's, it's fine with me. I mean, this is sooo natural, and so beautiful, and...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Seriously? You're okay with that?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Of course. I mean, there's nothing erotic about this, you know, it's, it's, it's what these [shakes a breast] were made for, you know, I mean they're full of baby milk, they're... nourishing my baby, so... [tosses head proudly, Creed comes up to stand next to Kevin, staring directly at Jan's chest] Michael!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hello, spoiled little baby, [to a watermelon] in your fancy brand name stroller. Mmm, I wonder if it's as safe as they say it is. Oh, look, a curb. Uh oh, let's see what happens... [lets it go, it flies off the curb, stays upright, and stops safely] Inconclusive. [pushes it out into the street, it rolls to a stop] Spartans would leave a weak baby by the side of the road. My parents left me beside the road. I crawled home.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Not so weak, huh, Mom?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Gosh, Mommy feels like taking a jog. [runs with stroller] Oh, no! Mommy forgot to wear a bra, and her big fake boobs are really hurting her, and she needs to let go, she can't control the stroller any longer [forcefully pushes stroller away toward uneven ground with junk strewn around, the stroller hits some junk, stays upright, and stops safely]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let's see what this baby can do... [drives car fast, holding stroller alongside the car, stroller remains fine] Aaaah! Aa-aaah! [throws it ahead of the car, it goes for a while and then is stopping] It's a hardy stroller. [takes watermelon out of stroller, holds it up to show camera] Maybe it's safe!
